intro: Wilbrandia scabra, commonly known as the rough-leaved wilbrandia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. Wilbrandia scabra thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological studies and horticultural interest.
